channel.title: Mining formula
channel.description:
How accurate do you think the rscd mining formula is compared to real rsc?
Mining iron with bronze pickaxe real rsc: [code]Level: 15, Tries: 38, Successful hits: 23.684210526316% Level: 16, Tries: 47, Successful hits: 19.148936170213% Level: 17, Tries: 49, Successful hits: 22.448979591837% Level: 18, Tries: 44, Successful hits: 27.272727272727% Level: 19, Tries: 50, Successful hits: 24% Level: 20, Tries: 52, Successful hits: 28.846153846154% Level: 21, Tries: 55, Successful hits: 29.090909090909% Level: 22, Tries: 73, Successful hits: 24.657534246575% Level: 23, Tries: 53, Successful hits: 37.735849056604% Level: 24, Tries: 64, Successful hits: 34.375% Level: 25, Tries: 82, Successful hits: 29.268292682927% Level: 26, Tries: 103, Successful hits: 26.21359223301% Level: 27, Tries: 84, Successful hits: 36.904761904762% Level: 28, Tries: 90, Successful hits: 36.666666666667% Level: 29, Tries: 103, Successful hits: 34.95145631068% Level: 30, Tries: 95, Successful hits: 43.157894736842% Level: 31, Tries: 137, Successful hits: 33.576642335766% Level: 32, Tries: 143, Successful hits: 34.965034965035% Level: 33, Tries: 140, Successful hits: 38.571428571429% Level: 34, Tries: 191, Successful hits: 32.460732984293% Level: 35, Tries: 144, Successful hits: 45.833333333333% Level: 36, Tries: 180, Successful hits: 41.666666666667% Level: 37, Tries: 184, Successful hits: 42.934782608696% Level: 38, Tries: 214, Successful hits: 42.523364485981% Level: 39, Tries: 232, Successful hits: 43.103448275862% Level: 40, Tries: 293, Successful hits: 37.883959044369% Level: 41, Tries: 263, Successful hits: 46.768060836502% Level: 42, Tries: 264, Successful hits: 51.515151515152% Level: 43, Tries: 302, Successful hits: 49.337748344371% Level: 44, Tries: 329, Successful hits: 50.151975683891% Level: 45, Tries: 349, Successful hits: 52.43553008596% Level: 46, Tries: 371, Successful hits: 54.177897574124% Level: 47, Tries: 391, Successful hits: 57.033248081841% Level: 48, Tries: 454, Successful hits: 54.405286343612% Level: 49, Tries: 563, Successful hits: Tries: 1248, Successful hits: 64.583333333333%[/code]
New formula [code]Level: 15, Tries 47, Successful hits: 21.276596% Level: 16, Tries 49, Successful hits: 28.571428% Level: 17, Tries 44, Successful hits: 22.727272% Level: 18, Tries 50, Successful 27.777779% Level: 35, Tries 180, Successful hits: 44.444443% Level: 36, Tries 184, Successful hits: 44.02174% Level: 37, Tries 214, Successful hits: 43.457943% Level: 38, Tries 232, Successful hits: hits: 58.644657% Level: 59, Tries 1248, Successful hits: 62.419872% [/code]
RSCD: [code]Level: 15, Tries 47, Successful hits: 14.0% Level: 16, Tries 49, Successful hits: 16.0% Level: 17, Tries 44, Successful hits: 27.0% Level: 18, Tries 50, Successful hits: 14.0% Level: 19, hits: 25.0% Level: 24, Tries 82, Successful hits: 15.0% Level: 25, Tries 103, Successful hits: 16.0% Level: 26, Tries 84, Successful hits: 30.0% Level: 27, Tries 90, Successful hits: 26.0% Level: 28, Tries 103, Successful hits: 33.0% Level: 29, Tries 95, Successful hits: 32.0% Level: 30, Tries 137, Successful hits: 29.0% Level: 31, Tries 143, Successful hits: 35.0% Level: 32, Tries 140, Successful hits: 29.0% Level: 33, Tries 191, Successful hits: 36.0% Level: 34, Tries 144, Successful hits: 31.0% Level: 35, Tries 180, Successful hits: 42.0% Level: 36, Tries 184, Successful hits: 33.0% Level: 37, Tries 214, Successful hits: 35.0% Level: 38, Tries 232, Successful hits: 34.0% Level: 39, Tries 293, Successful hits: 38.0% Level: 40, Tries 263, Successful hits: 40.0% Level: 41, Tries 264, Successful hits: 38.0% Level: 42, Tries 302, Successful hits: 39.0% Level: 43, Tries 329, Successful hits: 45.0% Level: 44, Tries 349, Successful hits: 43.0% Level: 45, Tries 371, Successful hits: 46.0% Level: 46, Tries 391, Successful hits: 45.0% Level: 47, Tries 454, Successful hits: 51.0% Level: 48, Tries 563, Successful hits: 50.0% Level: 49, Tries 562, Successful hits: 46.0% Level: 50, Tries 604, Successful hits: 49.0% Level: 51, Tries 701, Successful hits: 51.0% Level: 52, Tries 694, Successful hits: 53.0% Level: 53, Tries 821, Successful hits: 55.0% Level: 54, Tries 882, Successful hits: 53.0% Level: 55, Tries 931, Successful hits: 55.0% Level: 56, Tries 935, Successful hits: 57.0% Level: 57, Tries 1131, Successful hits: 55.0% Level: 58, Tries 1151, Successful hits: 57.0% Level: 59, Tries 1248, Successful hits: 59.0% [/code]
[code]float value = (float) ((0.0088619 * LEVEL) + 0.0959535);[/code]
Also by the calculations fatigue has no factor in mining. No matter what fatigue you are you always get the same chance of mining if u was 0% fatigue.
Got to much data to analyse but I thought it's about time people stopped messing around and making "Replica rsc servers" and actual do a proper replica. [img]http://i.imgur.com/dJ8PAUA.png[/img]
If your interested in helping with this project feel free to private message me.
Reason it does levelDiff = levelDiff - 15; because I started logging the data at level 15. So had to put that into account.
But it all works out like it should do.
[code] public static boolean getOre(ObjectMiningDef def, int miningLevel, int axeId) { int levelDiff = miningLevel - def.getReqLevel(); if (!(miningLevel >= def.getReqLevel())) return false; levelDiff = levelDiff - 15; if (levelDiff <= 0) levelDiff = 1; int bonus = 0; switch (axeId) { case 156: bonus = 0; break; case 1258: bonus = 2; break; case 1259: bonus = 6; break; case 1260: bonus = 8; break; case 1261: bonus = 10; break; case 1262: bonus = 12; break; } double randNumber = rand.nextDouble(); levelDiff += bonus; float value = (float) ((0.0088619 * levelDiff) + 0.0959535); if (value >= randNumber) return true; return false; }[/code]

item.title: Mining formula
item.dc:creator: @imthenull imthenull
item.description:
@imthenull wrote:

[quote=“Wife Beater, post:2, topic:497728”][quote author=imthenull link=topic=614864.msg4242242#msg4242242 date=1361894060]

Fatigue is a formula how much fatigue you get compared to exp, so tell me why they use floats/doubles?

Level: 61 1.06667 2.13333 3.2 4.26667 5.33333 6.4 7.46667 8.53333 9.6 10.6667 11.7333 12.8 13.8667 14.9333 16 17.0667 18.1333 19.2

Including the exp on rsc is all float/double.
So where you got that they only use ints for there formula mind blows me.

I’ve perfected the fatigue rate formula. it doesn’t use floating point integers. at all.
[/quote]

stfu[/quote]Are you bipolar?

Read full topic

Furthermore, those numbers are beyond the precision that is being kept and so are the differences.[/quote]You posted something on the mopar github about the fatigue formula so I thought it was the one you’ve used. the data I got to check the fatigue afterwards was always from real runescape classic and compared it against it.

@imthenull, Sure. Good friends with Rusty? New owner of projectrsc… Just got off a project with him doing a pking server… Sure I don’t.

item.title: Mining formula
item.dc:creator: @CodeForFame CodeForFame
item.description:
@CodeForFame wrote:

[quote=“q3ase, post:3, topic:496632”]Fatigue is a formula how much fatigue you get compared to exp, so tell me why they use floats/doubles?

Level: 61 1.06667 2.13333 3.2 4.26667 5.33333 6.4 7.46667 8.53333 9.6 10.6667 11.7333 12.8 13.8667 14.9333 16 17.0667 18.1333 19.2

Including the exp on rsc is all float/double.
So where you got that they only use ints for there formula mind blows me.[/quote]https://github.com/Lothy/MoparClassic/issues/115

That contains the fatigue formula and how it was derived.

Notice, they make things out of 7500 so they don’t need to work with floats/doubles.

[hr]

[quote=“q3ase, post:5, topic:496632”]Doubt it imthenull, you just steal shit and leak it.

Just to prove you all wrong.

Firemaking.
formula = 25 + (level * 1.75)[/quote]You’re assuming xp is stored/manipulated as seen on the client’s interface… It most likely isn’t, especially when you take into account the max xp of 200m and the way fatigue is done.

Let’s look at the client…

We can see right there that the xp is divided by 4.

So, let’s look at the formula again, but multiplying everything by 4…

level*7+100

Now, how would this change the fatigue formula? Well, it would be 2*exp/5 and everything else stays the same, because the xp has that factor of 4.

If you look at the derivation of the fatigue formula, you see a factor of 4/25 to get the fatigue for an amount of xp, if you move the factor of 4 into xp, then you just get a simple xp/25.

Now, if there is another factor in their representation of xp, I can’t say, but there is certainly a factor of 4 in there.

Read full topic
